Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora with handle root; exterior: glazed handle zone to left; in reserved panel, with black framing line on left, black-figure decoration consisting of part of horse's or satyr's tail to right.
Curator's comments: This sherd comes from side B of a small panel amphora (probably a neck-amphora) to which also several other fragments belong: British Museum 1965,0930.844 and 1965,0930.845, Brighton and Hove Museums HA281488, Boston 88.827, and Reading, Ure Museum 26.2.74-75, 26.2.76 and 26.2.77. See Williams, D. 'In the Manner of the Gorgon Painter: the Deianeira Painter and Others’, in H. A. G. Brijder, A. A. Drukker and C. W. Neeft (eds) Enthousiasmos. Essays on Greek and Related Pottery presented to J. M. Hemelrijk. Amsterdam 1986, 61-8, esp. 62-65, fig. 4.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 303, no. B303)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0016) (Phase 1)
